userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Failed a tones with worsening DEXA, have Bipolar depression/ mood disorder with generalized anxiety

carousel_items: If you're taking the fast release medication, take it first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 30 minutes after you've taken the fast release medication.
If you're taking the extended release medication, take it after your first meal of the day with at least a half cup of water.
Stay sitting or standing and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
If you forget to take your dose, skip it and take it the following morning.
Some of these medications are only taken once or twice a month, others are taken once a week and others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

basics.benefits_moa: Actonel is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Actonel is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but how you have to take it can be a hassle.
downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.

upsides: Available in oral tablets that can be taken once or twice a month, once a week, or once a day.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in oral tablets that can be taken once or twice a month, once a week, or once a day.

userStories.identifier: active retiree. No other medical conditi
userStories.tip: Repaired the bone loss within the 1st year that I took it.

drugs.name: Actonel

off-label_indications.indication: Low bone mineral density due to Inflammatory Bowel Disease
condition_url_name: Bone loss in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)

carousel_items_processed.orig: If you're taking the fast release medication, take it first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 30 minutes after you've taken the fast release medication.
If you're taking the extended release medication, take it after your first meal of the day with at least a half cup of water.
Stay sitting or standing and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
If you forget to take your dose, skip it and take it the following morning.
Some of these medications are only taken once or twice a month, others are taken once a week and others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Actonel.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Actonel.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

clock.tip: Works more slowly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Fosamax is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Fosamax is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but taking it can be a hassle.
downsides: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

upsides: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

userStories.identifier: On disability due to a neck injury.
userStories.tip: Must take on an empty stomach, first thing in am, with a full glass of water (only water). Must stay upright (either standing or sitting up) for at least a half hour. May cause esophagus irritation or ulcers. May cause reflux.

userStories.identifier: Used to be a very active senior.
userStories.tip: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG! I was on it for 10 yrs when my right femur broke while taking a simple walk. Xrays showed that my left femur had a hairline facture and would break eventually, so I now have rods in both legs and never without pain.
I wish I had known about the effects on the jaw bone (osteonecrosis)

carousel_items: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

upsides: You only have to take this once a year.

upsides_processed.orig: You only have to take this once a year.

userStories.tip: After IV injection had severe inflammatory reaction for 3 days, bed ridden with chills, high fever and severe muscle and bone pains

carousel_items: Take at the first sign of discomfort.
You might need to take more than once a day but pay attention to the instructions on your bottle to avoid overdosing.
You need to separate Tums from some medications to avoid interactions.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease on dialysis may need to take a lower dose or avoid use. Your doctor can do blood tests to see if it's safe to use.
Don't take if you have high blood calcium levels.

basics.benefits_moa: Tums is an antacid. It counteracts the effects of stomach acid to relieve heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion).
basics.bottom_line: Tums gives quick relief for heartburn, but don't expect it to last all day.
downsides: Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.

upsides: Available over the counter without a prescription.

upsides_processed.orig: Available over the counter without a prescription.

drugs.name: Tums

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take at the first sign of discomfort.
You might need to take more than once a day but pay attention to the instructions on your bottle to avoid overdosing.
You need to separate Tums from some medications to avoid interactions.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease on dialysis may need to take a lower dose or avoid use. Your doctor can do blood tests to see if it's safe to use.
Don't take if you have high blood calcium levels.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood calcium
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.
risk_factors: Taking high doses of Vitamin D

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Tums contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Tums. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

description_processed.orig: Tums contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Tums. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

carousel_items: You should be sitting or lying down when you inject Forteo since it can make you dizzy.
You should inject Forteo under the skin in either your thigh or stomach.
Make sure the liquid in the vial of Forteo is clear and colorless before you inject it. Don't use it if it looks cloudy, colored, or if you see particles inside.

basics.benefits_moa: Forteo works by stimulating cells that build up and strengthen your bones.
basics.bottom_line: Forteo is a good second-choice medication to treat bone loss, but it's only available as an injectable.
downsides: Only available as a brand medication, so it can be expensive.
You have to inject this every day, so it may not be a good option if you don't like needles.
Shouldn't take this longer than 18 to 24 months since it can increase the risk of bone cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand medication, so it can be expensive.
You have to inject this every day, so it may not be a good option if you don't like needles.
Shouldn't take this longer than 18 to 24 months since it can increase the risk of bone cancers.

upsides: If you're unable to use bisphosphonates or are still having fractures despite being on other medications, Forteo can be a good alternative.
You can start using Forteo as soon as you stop using bisphosphonates.

upsides_processed.orig: If you're unable to use bisphosphonates or are still having fractures despite being on other medications, Forteo can be a good alternative.
You can start using Forteo as soon as you stop using bisphosphonates.

userStories.tip: female 68 years old prescribed forteo.Had very unpleasant side effects. Headache, nauseas,muscles pain extreme tiredness, mental confusion,heart burnt, loose stools, hail falling. After all these side effects persisting for one month I have decided to stop.
Female 68 years old. After scanner I was told by my docto r to start on Forsteo. The side effects where very unpleasant
Only drug that has stabilized my osteoporosis. It is a commitment to take it every day, since it is an injection.  Worth the hassle.
lots of early side effects--bone and joint pain.  have dissipated.  bad cramps

drugs.name: Forteo

carousel_items_processed.orig: You should be sitting or lying down when you inject Forteo since it can make you dizzy.
You should inject Forteo under the skin in either your thigh or stomach.
Make sure the liquid in the vial of Forteo is clear and colorless before you inject it. Don't use it if it looks cloudy, colored, or if you see particles inside.

risks_warnings.title: Malignant tumor of the bone
risks_warnings.description: In studies with animals, Forteo caused an increase in the incidence of osteosarcoma (a malignant bone tumor) that was dependent on the medication dose and treatment duration. Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

description_processed.orig: In studies with animals, Forteo caused an increase in the incidence of osteosarcoma (a malignant bone tumor) that was dependent on the medication dose and treatment duration. Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: High calcium blood levels
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

risks_warnings.title: Positional low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

description_processed.orig: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Forteo while you are also taking digoxin, it can affect the blood levels of digoxin and cause toxicity.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Forteo while you are also taking digoxin, it can affect the blood levels of digoxin and cause toxicity.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Failed a tones with worsening DEXA, have Bipolar depression/ mood disorder with generalized anxiety
